Konstantin Nomerotski

New York, NY | k-nom@outlook.com | +1 929 682 7099 | www.linkedin.com/in/k-nom/

Education

University of Bristol

MSci Chemistry with Scientific Computing - First-class honors

Sept 2020 – Jun 2024

Relevant modules: Data Science, Software Engineering and High-Powered Computing, AI and Deep Learning, Scientific Computing, Math, Practical Chemistry, Core Chemistry, Models and Predictions

Thesis project - The Efficient Calculation of photo-absorption cross-sections for Volatile Organic Compounds (Learn more)

  • Implemented representative sampling method using simulated annealing and Kullback-Leibler divergence algorithms, reducing computational burden by 70% while maintaining spectral accuracy
  • Developed a high-performance Python framework integrating with open source quantum chemistry modules, enabling efficient exploration of larger and more complex molecules
  • Designed automated workflow using SLURM and Bash scripts, streamlining complex quantum chemistry calculations including data postprocessing and visualization

Technical Proficiencies

  • Programming Languages: Python | SQL | C++ | Bash
  • Frameworks and Tools: Git | Linux (Ubuntu) | SLURM | MPI | Bash | Unix | MS | Latex | Docker
  • Scientific Computing: NumPy | SciPy | Pandas | Scikit-learn | MolML | ORCA
  • Visualization Tools: Matplotlib | Bokeh | Seaborn | Jupyter | iPyWidgets

Project Experience

Biscuit dunking data analysis (Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib)

Feb 2024 - Apr 2024

  • Conducted comprehensive exploratory data analysis (EDA) on biscuit dunking experiment data using Pandas and Matplotlib to investigate the porosity of different types of biscuits.
  • Implemented and compared multiple regression models, including the physics-based Washburn model and Random Forest Regression, enabling the prediction of biscuit capillary flow without costly lab experiments
  • Developed and fine-tuned a Random Forest Classifier achieving 96% average accuracy classification, providing a viable insilico method for the classification of biscuits using machine learning

Distributed data processing (Docker, Docker Swarm, Jupyter)

Oct 2023 – Dec 2023

  • Engineered multiservice application for analyzing Higgs boson decay pathways, transforming monolithic script into scalable microservices architecture
  • Containerized analysis pipeline using Docker and demonstrated scalability using Docker Swarm, leveraging consistent deployment across environments and dynamic resource allocation
  • Implemented asynchronous message queuing with RabbitMQ, eliminating race conditions and reducing inter- mediate storage requirements by 40%

Atmospec Visualization Module (iPyWidgets, Bokeh, Numpy)

Jan 2023 - May 2023

  • Designed and integrated an interactive data visualization module within the AtmoSpec application, enabling dynamic visualization of photolysis rate data for atmospheric research.
  • Developed the visualization tool using Bokeh, iPyWidgets, and NumPy within a Jupyter web application, enhancing user experience and data interpretability.
  • Led the integration of the photolysis rate calculation module in a Linux environment, ensuring seamless deployment via Docker for consistent performance across platforms.

Other Experience

Adelina Yard – Fine Dining Waiter

Sept 2022 – Present

  • Refined time management and teamwork skills, looking after up to 28 guests as a team of 3 over multiple courses, maintaining calm under pressure and anticipating guests’ needs
  • Developed client relation skills by interacting with guests ensuring their expectations were exceeded, ensuring a memorable dining experience through attentive and personalized service.
  • Demonstrated extensive knowledge of the menu and wine pairings, assisting guests in making informed choices that enhanced their dining experience.

The Albion – Waiter / Bartender

Sept 2020 – Jul 2022

  • Prepared and served a variety of cocktails, beers, and other beverages, maintaining consistency and adhering to established recipes
  • Provided guests with drinks recommendations to suit their needs, helping them navigate the full bar as well as over 20 beers on tap. Similarly, pointing out my favorites on the food menu.
  • Looked after large private partys, helping people celebrate engagements, birthdays, and christmas partys. Making sure everyone was comfortable and taken care of.

Skills

  • Languages: English and Russian (fluent)
  • Soft Skills: Project Management, Group Collaboration, Time-Management, Organization, Leadership, Working under pressure
